title: Awesome List Updates on Aug 30, 2023
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Aug 30, 2023 - Track Awesome List

items.title: GoBooks
items.content_text:
### 2022 - [Pro Go](https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-1-4842-7355-5) / Why does this book look so different?

*   Gain a solid understanding of the Go language and tools
*   Gain in-depth knowledge of the Go standard library
*   Use Go for concurrent/parallel tasks
*   Use Go for client- and server-side development
items.content_html:
2022 - Pro Go / Why does this book look so different?

  • Gain a solid understanding of the Go language and tools
  • Gain in-depth knowledge of the Go standard library
  • Use Go for concurrent/parallel tasks
  • Use Go for client- and server-side development

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Official documentation

*   [Keynote on Polars at EuroSciPy 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTVm3QyJ-3I\&t=43s) ⏳ `57 min` - Talk by [@ritchie46](https://github.com/ritchie46) that dives into Polars and sees what makes it so efficient.  It will touch on technologies like Arrow, Rust, parallelism, data structures, query optimization and more.

### Rust / Miscellaneous

*   [Polars CLI (⭐184)](https://github.com/pola-rs/polars-cli) `Polars CLI` is a command line interface for running SQL queries with Polars as backend.

### Tutorials & workshops / Miscellaneous

*   [Python Polars: A Lightning-Fast DataFrame Library](https://realpython.com/polars-python/) - A tutorial that shows how to use Polars with Python ecosystem by [@hfhoffman1144](https://github.com/hfhoffman1144). Code used is available on Github [here (⭐4.9k)](https://github.com/realpython/materials/tree/master/python-polars).

### Talks and videos / Miscellaneous

*   [Using the Rust Polars DataFrame library in a CLI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUQaoAcc95M) ⏳ `4 min` - A video that shows how to integrate Polars in a commande line interface by [@paiml](https://github.com/paiml).
*   [The Ultimate Guide to Data Wrangling with Python | Rust Polars Data Frame](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=keCvzMihDfk\&list=PLp0TENYyY8lHJaY4t5bAihnFS5TBUQYV1) ⏳ `10 videos` - A playlist of 10 videos (WIP) that equips you with all the necessary knowledge required to utilize Python Polars Data Frame by [@AmitXShukla](https://github.com/AmitXShukla).
items.content_html:
Official documentation

  • Keynote on Polars at EuroSciPy 2023 ⏳ 57 min - Talk by @ritchie46 that dives into Polars and sees what makes it so efficient. It will touch on technologies like Arrow, Rust, parallelism, data structures, query optimization and more.

Rust / Miscellaneous

  • Polars CLI (⭐184) Polars CLI is a command line interface for running SQL queries with Polars as backend.

Tutorials & workshops / Miscellaneous

  • Python Polars: A Lightning-Fast DataFrame Library - A tutorial that shows how to use Polars with Python ecosystem by @hfhoffman1144. Code used is available on Github here (⭐4.9k).

Talks and videos / Miscellaneous

  • Using the Rust Polars DataFrame library in a CLI ⏳ 4 min - A video that shows how to integrate Polars in a commande line interface by @paiml.
  • The Ultimate Guide to Data Wrangling with Python | Rust Polars Data Frame ⏳ 10 videos - A playlist of 10 videos (WIP) that equips you with all the necessary knowledge required to utilize Python Polars Data Frame by @AmitXShukla.

items.title: Awesome Terraform
items.content_text:
### Self-Hosted Registries / Miscellaneous

*   [citizen (⭐641)](https://github.com/outsideris/citizen) - Private Terraform Module/Provider Registry
*   [nrkno/terraform-registry (⭐109)](https://github.com/nrkno/terraform-registry) - A private Terraform registry with modular store backends.
*   [petra (⭐44)](https://github.com/devoteamgcloud/petra) - Private Terraform Registry Manager
*   [philips-labs/terraform-registry (⭐96)](https://github.com/philips-labs/terraform-registry) - Terraform registry to serve arbitrary Terraform provider releases hosted on Github
*   [tapir (⭐223)](https://github.com/PacoVK/tapir) - Private Terraform Registry.
*   [terraform-simple-registry (⭐68)](https://github.com/apparentlymart/terraform-simple-registry) - Simple implementation of the Terraform registry protocols.
*   [Terrareg (⭐303)](https://github.com/matthewjohn/terrareg) - Terraform module registry.

### Providers / Community providers

*   [terraform-provider-docker (⭐713)](https://github.com/kreuzwerker/terraform-provider-docker) - Terraform Docker provider.
*   [terraform-provider-terracurl (⭐147)](https://github.com/devops-rob/terraform-provider-terracurl) - Provider to make managed and unmanaged API calls to your target endpoint.

### Tools / Community providers

*   [balcony](https://oguzhan-yilmaz.github.io/balcony/) - CLI tool for easy AWS API reads. Also generates Terraform import-blocks, and actual Terraform Resource code.
*   [burrito](https://padok-team.github.io/burrito/) - Burrito is a TACoS (Terraform Automation Collaboration Software) Kubernetes Operator.
*   [cfnctl (⭐136)](https://github.com/rogerwelin/cfnctl) - Cfnctl brings the Terraform cli experience to AWS Cloudformation.
*   [dxw/terrafile (⭐2)](https://github.com/dxw/terrafile) - Systematically manage external modules from Github for use in Terraform (written in Ruby).
*   [pytest-terraform (⭐58)](https://github.com/cloud-custodian/pytest-terraform) - pytest terraform plugin with fixtures and offline replay support.
*   [renovate-config (⭐50)](https://github.com/SpotOnInc/renovate-config) - Sharable Config Presets for Renovatebot, especially useful for DevOps folks.
*   [stacks (⭐182)](https://github.com/cisco-open/stacks) - Stacks, the Terraform code pre-processor
*   [terracove](https://elementtech.github.io/terracove/) - Recursively test a directory tree for Terraform diffs and coverage.
*   [terraeasy (⭐35)](https://github.com/jaceq/terraeasy) - Easy Terraform wrapper
*   [terraform-cleaner (⭐178)](https://github.com/sylwit/terraform-cleaner) - Tiny utility which detects unused variables in your terraform modules.
*   [terramagic (⭐47)](https://github.com/miltlima/terramagic) - Wizard tool for create folders and terraform files automated, written in Python !
*   [terrap-cli (⭐67)](https://github.com/sirrend/terrap-cli) - Terrap - a powerful CLI tool that scans your infrastructure and identifies any required changes.
*   [terrars (⭐109)](https://github.com/andrewbaxter/terrars) - Terrars is a tool for building Terraform stacks in Rust. This is an alternative to the CDK.
*   [terrascope (⭐29)](https://github.com/spilliams/terrascope) - Build orchestrator for terraform monorepos.
*   [terrashine](https://isawan.github.io/terrashine/) - Terrashine is a terraform provider mirror1 implementation that works by automatically caching dependencies as providers are requested.
*   [tfgen (⭐87)](https://github.com/refl3ction/tfgen) - Terraform code generator for consistent codebase and DRY.
*   [tfrepl (⭐32)](https://github.com/ysoftwareab/tfrepl) - A Terraform REPL, giving you a full shell experience. Readline based. No dependencies. Save config changes. History.
*   [tfsort (⭐222)](https://github.com/AlexNabokikh/tfsort) - CLI utility to sort Terraform variables and outputs.
*   [travelgrunt (⭐69)](https://github.com/ivanilves/travelgrunt) - cd inside \[mono]repos without fatigue!

### Tools / CI

*   [setup-terraform (⭐1.5k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/setup-terraform) - Sets up Terraform CLI in your GitHub Actions workflow.
*   [terraform-plan (⭐64)](https://github.com/cds-snc/terraform-plan) - GitHub Action to run Terraform plan and add a comment with the changes.

### Tools / IDE

*   [vscode-terraform-live-graph (⭐240)](https://github.com/adamiBs/vscode-terraform-live-graph) - Terraform Live Graph Extension for Visual Studio Code is a plugin that allows you to generate a live Terraform graph as you code.
items.content_html:
Self-Hosted Registries / Miscellaneous

  • citizen (⭐641) - Private Terraform Module/Provider Registry
  • nrkno/terraform-registry (⭐109) - A private Terraform registry with modular store backends.
  • petra (⭐44) - Private Terraform Registry Manager
  • philips-labs/terraform-registry (⭐96) - Terraform registry to serve arbitrary Terraform provider releases hosted on Github
  • tapir (⭐223) - Private Terraform Registry.
  • terraform-simple-registry (⭐68) - Simple implementation of the Terraform registry protocols.
  • Terrareg (⭐303) - Terraform module registry.

Providers / Community providers

  • terraform-provider-docker (⭐713) - Terraform Docker provider.
  • terraform-provider-terracurl (⭐147) - Provider to make managed and unmanaged API calls to your target endpoint.

Tools / Community providers

  • balcony - CLI tool for easy AWS API reads. Also generates Terraform import-blocks, and actual Terraform Resource code.
  • burrito - Burrito is a TACoS (Terraform Automation Collaboration Software) Kubernetes Operator.
  • cfnctl (⭐136) - Cfnctl brings the Terraform cli experience to AWS Cloudformation.
  • dxw/terrafile (⭐2) - Systematically manage external modules from Github for use in Terraform (written in Ruby).
  • pytest-terraform (⭐58) - pytest terraform plugin with fixtures and offline replay support.
  • renovate-config (⭐50) - Sharable Config Presets for Renovatebot, especially useful for DevOps folks.
  • stacks (⭐182) - Stacks, the Terraform code pre-processor
  • terracove - Recursively test a directory tree for Terraform diffs and coverage.
  • terraeasy (⭐35) - Easy Terraform wrapper
  • terraform-cleaner (⭐178) - Tiny utility which detects unused variables in your terraform modules.
  • terramagic (⭐47) - Wizard tool for create folders and terraform files automated, written in Python !
  • terrap-cli (⭐67) - Terrap - a powerful CLI tool that scans your infrastructure and identifies any required changes.
  • terrars (⭐109) - Terrars is a tool for building Terraform stacks in Rust. This is an alternative to the CDK.
  • terrascope (⭐29) - Build orchestrator for terraform monorepos.
  • terrashine - Terrashine is a terraform provider mirror1 implementation that works by automatically caching dependencies as providers are requested.
  • tfgen (⭐87) - Terraform code generator for consistent codebase and DRY.
  • tfrepl (⭐32) - A Terraform REPL, giving you a full shell experience. Readline based. No dependencies. Save config changes. History.
  • tfsort (⭐222) - CLI utility to sort Terraform variables and outputs.
  • travelgrunt (⭐69) - cd inside [mono]repos without fatigue!

Tools / CI

  • setup-terraform (⭐1.5k) - Sets up Terraform CLI in your GitHub Actions workflow.
  • terraform-plan (⭐64) - GitHub Action to run Terraform plan and add a comment with the changes.

Tools / IDE

  • vscode-terraform-live-graph (⭐240) - Terraform Live Graph Extension for Visual Studio Code is a plugin that allows you to generate a live Terraform graph as you code.

items.title: Awesome Plotters
items.content_text:
### Software / Vector Creation

*   [LineDream](https://linedream.marcrleonard.com/) - A generative art library for Python that can export SVGs.
items.content_html:
Software / Vector Creation

  • LineDream - A generative art library for Python that can export SVGs.

items.title: Awesome Translations
items.content_text:
### Platforms / Project management

*   [Traduora (⭐2.1k)](https://github.com/traduora/traduora) - A platform to manage translation workflow in teams.

### Apps / Translation software

*   [OmegaT](https://omegat.org/) - Free translation memory / CAT software that works on Windows, macOS and Linux.
*   [Project Fluent](https://projectfluent.org) - Asymetric translations (eg. gender variations) for localization.

### Tools / Automatic translation for end users

*   [Watson Language Translator](https://www.ibm.com/cloud/watson-language-translator) - A service on the IBM Cloud that enables dynamically translation news, patents, or conversational documents.
*   [DeepL Translator](https://www.deepl.com/) - A neural machine translation service launched in August 2017 and owned by Cologne based DeepL SE.
*   [Amazon Translate](https://aws.amazon.com/translate/) - A neural machine translation service.
*   [ModernMT](https://www.modernmt.com/) - A self-learning machine translation service that improves from user corrections as user keep using it.
*   [Microsoft Translator](https://translator.microsoft.com/) - A multilingual machine translation cloud service provided by Microsoft.

### Tools / Libraries and tools for developers

*   [ICU - International Components for Unicode](https://icu.unicode.org/) - A mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications.
*   [Django docs - i18n](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.1/topics/i18n/) - Part of the Django docs, focused on internationalization and localization.

### Tools / Machine translation for developers

*   [AutoML Translation Documentation](https://cloud.google.com/translate/automl/docs) - AutoML Translation by Google.

### Books / Machine translation

*   [Glocalization Strategy Playbook (⭐46)](https://github.com/GILT-Forum/Globalization-Strategy-Playbook) - A Guide for Localization and Globalization Professionals by the GILT forum.
items.content_html:

  • Amazon Translate - A neural machine translation service.
  • ModernMT - A self-learning machine translation service that improves from user corrections as user keep using it.
  • Microsoft Translator - A multilingual machine translation cloud service provided by Microsoft.

Tools / Libraries and tools for developers

  • Django docs - i18n - Part of the Django docs, focused on internationalization and localization.

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### C, C++

*   [endatabas (⭐281)](https://github.com/endatabas/endb) - Schemaless SQL document database with full history. [AGPL-3.0](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/License:Apache2.0).
    *   built in Common Lisp and Rust.
    *   in development, alpha product scheduled for Q2 of 2024. [roadmap](https://docs.endatabas.com/appendix/roadmap.html).
items.content_html:
C, C++

  • endatabas (⭐281) - Schemaless SQL document database with full history. AGPL-3.0.
    • built in Common Lisp and Rust.
    • in development, alpha product scheduled for Q2 of 2024. roadmap.

items.title: Awesome Connectivity Info
items.content_text:
### Connectivity Maps

*   [Telegeography Cloud Infrastructure Map](https://www.cloudinfrastructuremap.com/) - Map of cloud infastructure providers around the world.

### Regional Connectivity Reports and Data

*   RIA Africa Mobile Pricing (RAMP) Indices Portal - ([Q3 2022](https://researchictafrica.net/research-ict-africa-ramp-index-2/)) - Pricing information on Voice/SMS basket, 1GB data basket, and Value For Money bundles.

### Other sources

*   [IPinfo.io - Country Pages](https://ipinfo.io/countries) - Summary of country-level IP data covering top ASNs, important routers, city-level information, carrier IPs, and other IP data.
items.content_html:
Connectivity Maps

  • Telegeography Cloud Infrastructure Map - Map of cloud infastructure providers around the world.

Regional Connectivity Reports and Data

  • RIA Africa Mobile Pricing (RAMP) Indices Portal - (Q3 2022) - Pricing information on Voice/SMS basket, 1GB data basket, and Value For Money bundles.

Other sources

  • IPinfo.io - Country Pages - Summary of country-level IP data covering top ASNs, important routers, city-level information, carrier IPs, and other IP data.
